content:
HttpServerUtilityWrapper Class

In this Article

Encapsulates the HTTP intrinsic object that provides helper methods for processing Web requests.

Syntax

Declaration

public class HttpServerUtilityWrapper : System.Web.HttpServerUtilityBase

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.Web.HttpServerUtilityBase
  • HttpServerUtilityWrapper

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Remarks

The HttpServerUtilityWrapper class derives from the HttpServerUtilityBase class and serves as a wrapper for the HttpServerUtility class. This class exposes the functionality of the HttpServerUtility class while also exposing the HttpServerUtilityBase type. The HttpServerUtilityBase class enables you to replace the original implementation of the HttpServerUtility class in your application with a custom implementation, such as when you perform unit testing outside the ASP.NET pipeline.

Initializes a new instance of the HttpServerUtilityWrapper class.

ScriptTimeout

Executes the handler for the specified virtual path in the context of the current request, using a TextWriter instance to capture output from the page and a value that indicates whether to clear the stem.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString* and stem.Web.HttpRequest.Form* collections.

Executes the specified handler in the context of the current process, using a TextWriter instance to capture output from the executed handler and a value that specifies whether to clear the stem.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString* and stem.Web.HttpRequest.Form* collections.

Terminates execution of the current page and starts execution of a different page or handler by using the specified URL and a value that specifies whether to clear the stem.Web.HttpRequestBase.QueryString* and stem.Web.HttpRequestBase.Form* collections.

  • Execute(String,TextWriter)

    Executes the handler for the specified virtual path in the context of the current process, using a TextWriter instance to capture output from the executed handler.

    public override void Execute (string path, System.IO.TextWriter writer);

    Parameters

    • path
      String

      The URL of the handler to execute.

    • writer
      TextWriter

      An object to capture the output.

    Exceptions

    • HttpException

      The current HttpContext is null.

      - or -

      An error occurred when the handler specified by path was executed.

    • ArgumentNullException

      path is null.

      - or -

      path is not a virtual path.

    Remarks

    The writer parameter is passed by reference to the Execute method. To retrieve the output from the handler after the method completes, you use the properties and methods of the writer object. For an example, see Execute.

  • Execute(String,TextWriter,Boolean)

    Executes the handler for the specified virtual path in the context of the current request, using a TextWriter instance to capture output from the page and a value that indicates whether to clear the stem.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString* and stem.Web.HttpRequest.Form* collections.

    Exceptions

      The current HttpContext instance is null.

      path ends with a period (.).

      - or -

      An error occurred when the handler specified by path was executed.

      path is null.

    • ArgumentException

      path is not a virtual path.

    • ArgumentException

  • TransferRequest(String,Boolean,String,NameValueCollection)

    Asynchronously executes the endpoint at the specified URL by using the specified HTTP method and headers.

    public override void TransferRequest (string path, bool preserveForm, string method, System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection headers);

    Parameters

    • path
      String

      The URL of the page or handler to execute.

    • preserveForm
      Boolean

      true to preserve the stem.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString* and stem.Web.HttpRequest.Form* collections; false to clear the stem.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString* and stem.Web.HttpRequest.Form* collections.

    • method
      String

      The HTTP method (GET, POST, and so on) to use for the new request. If null, the HTTP method of the original request is used.

    • headers
      NameValueCollection

      A collection of request headers for the new request.

    Exceptions

    • PlatformNotSupportedException

      The request requires IIS 7.0 running in integrated mode.

    • HttpException

      The server is not available to handle the request.

    • ArgumentNullException

      The path parameter is null.

    • ArgumentException

      The path parameter is invalid.

  • UrlTokenDecode(String)

    Decodes a URL string token into an equivalent byte array by using base64 digits.

    public override byte[] UrlTokenDecode (string input);

    Parameters

    • input
      String

      The URL string token to decode.

    Returns

      The byte array that contains the decoded URL string token.

    • ArgumentNullException

      The value of the input parameter is null.

  • UrlTokenEncode(Byte[])

    Encodes a byte array into an equivalent string representation by using base64 digits, which makes it usable for transmission on the URL.

    public override string UrlTokenEncode (byte[] input);

    Parameters

    • input
      Byte[]

      The byte array to encode.

    Returns

    • String

      The string that contains the encoded array if the length of input is greater than 1; otherwise, an empty string ("").

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      The value of the input parameter is null.
